article: Electronic books have changed the way many people read for  _  . Now online textbooks are changing the way some students learn and some teachers teach. More than  one hundred and seventy-five thousand  students go to the public schools in Fairfax County, Virginia, outside Washington. Last year, the school system used digital books in fifteen schools. This school year, middle schools and high schools changed  _  printed to electronic textbooks in their social studies classes. "I mean, it's just  _  's got it all online." says Luke Rosa, a history teacher at Falls Church High School. Peter Noonan, an assistant superintendent of schools says, "The world's changing  at all times  . And the online textbooks can change right along with the events that  are happening  ." "Digital books also cost  less  than printed textbooks," he says, "Usually it's between fifty and seventy dollars  to buy  " Social studies teacher Michael Bambara says the e-book he uses in his government class is better than a(an)  _  textbook. It has materials for students  with  different levels of reading skills...
